title: A good place to visit
review: Home of the governor, this is a government site famous for tourist... One can visit a museum located inside... Worth the travel..

title: nice walk
review: the governer house is situated in a very large area in nainital....just a short distance from the mall road...the walk is awesome through the forest area....the building is nicely maintained .... the place is quite high on cleanliness....

title: Pleasant Location
review: We travelled to Nainital in month of August. Of course it's is monsoon season.

title: old time charm.
review: this is the governors residence . ticket is 60 per head for a visit not even for 5 minutes. they take you walking to the enterance of the building and the lobby. beyond this single room and the front of the house you are not allowed anywhere. so avoid wasting time going there.

title: Great tourist spot
review: This has to be one of the best attraction of Nainital.  The entire compound is very well maintained.  The tour is conducted every hour and is accompanied by a guide.  Tourists are not allowed beyond a certain point in the Raj Bhavan and we ourselves are to be blamed for this.  We were told by the guide that some tourists damaged the property to the point that it was closed to be public and was reopened only in 2014 accompanied by a guide.  The Governor House is the Indian version of Buckingham Palace.  The interior and the antique furniture inside the building are great and one can appreciate the beauty and luxury of this British era building.

title: A heritage that is mind blowing
review: A miniature of the Windsor Castle in Nainital - its such a find! WHat the British left behind is just amazing! And the even better thing is that its maintained so beautifully - the Governor lives in it.

title: Nainital’s Best Attraction
review: I would call it Nainital’s attraction.

title: You need permission to visit this place
review: This used to be the Summer Residence of earlier Governor of U P and now of Uttrakhand. A real luxurious place which is well decorated and maintained.

title: Beautiful and Peaceful Surrounding
review: I visited the governor house on 28Dec2018 with my wife.The  governor house in nainital reminds you the period of britishers. Its a peaceful area.There are many beautiful points where you can click more beautiful pics.Itz more about  5-6 kilometers from bus stand of nainital.It would be better for you to hire motorcycle to ride to governor house,because it would be cheap .Before entering to governor house pay ticket amount Rs 50 or 100 per head. overall the experience is top of the world overthere.For more help you may mail us onto negiyoges25@gmail.com

title: Pleasant but not over memorable
review: We did this tour with some very friendly Indians.....It is not a long tour however and

title: Amazing architecture
review: Governor house was built by British in late 19th century. It's a huge building and provide lots of photo opportunity. Cost of entry ticket is Rs 50, it includes guided tour as well. Tour starts every hour, so plan your arrival accordingly. Only small portion of building is accessible to public and that is also as part of tour. Interior was amazing . Its a must visit place if you like historical building and architecture

title: Do go to see what our Governors enjoy
review: This is a lovely place. One may choose to go by hiking as this is located at about 1 hour of walk from Naini Lake/ Mall road. We went by car tough. The place is absolutely amazing. the ticket counter opens at 11 am and till then you can visit the Church which is just near to it. We went inside the Governor's house with a Guide. Photos are only allowed outside the main building- not inside. You are only allowed to go inside the main hall of the building, but further. But you could appreciate the beauty and luxury of the building from there only. Roam around to enjoy green fresh air and see the golf park. I loved the visit.

title: May 18 visit
review: Nice place to visit. Takes 15 mins from Mall Road. It opens @ 11 am and has a 30 mins brief tour of the same. You can only access the front area which is just a small lobby.

title: Grand
review: Must visit. The architecture is so grand. Especially, the fireplace and the stairs. The garden around has enough variety of species to keep a botanist occupied for hours. The guided tour is done well. Wait for the musical note at the end of every sentence of the guide

title: Beautiful & well maintained building
review: This is the beautiful & well maintained government building.Presently partly front portion of the ground floor is open for visitors. The garden is also well maintained.

title: Also called as rajbhavan
review: One of the main attraction of nainital and a must visit. Beautiful building, very well maintained and a treat to see. Built in british era. Beautiful interior, one will love to see.

title: beautiful building
review: the beauty of this building is added by the nature around it .. all time surrounded by clouds and in deep forest secluded ....

title: Rajbhawan guided tour
review: Recently visited Nainital with family and got a chance to Governer's house, which is nice experience. It is a guided tour (1 hour) and batches starts at 11 AM at the interval of 1 hour.

title: A Charming place -  Do not miss!
review: Please do not miss a visit to the Nainital Governor's House on any account. Its a handsome building modeled on the Buckingham Palace of England. Further, the walk from the entry to the House itself is fascinating giving visitors the chance to witness several species of trees and lush green well-maintained lawns with beautiful flowers.

title: Historic and Heritage building
review: It is a historic and Heritage property now known as Rajbhavan. Built as replica of Buckingham palace, it has 114 rooms. Guided tour is organised by tourism department and visitors are allowed to only few rooms inside. An architectural marvel and very well maintained.

title: NIce....must visit place
review: if you are exploring nanital then you have to go this place you will surely like it amazing views for clicks, nice and maintain property, guide will be there for assisting you.Its like replica of Bukingham Place....amazing even my friends also lyk this place

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Absolutely must visit. The building itself is gorgeous. It's a beautiful structure reminiscent of British architecture. And also quite well maintained. The road to walk inside the building is also beautifully lush.

title: Great Architecture
review: Raj Bhavan / Governer's House is situated atop the hill in Nainital. One must definitely make a visit here to appreciate the beauty and heritage of the british architecture.

title: Superb architecture
review: This is a live example of the great architecture of the Britishers. The Governor often visits this place once a week.

title: Awesome scenic beauty
review: Governor House is an amazing place to visit and to see historical war equipment. The floor was made by wood but the technology used in the past was unbeatable.The British made their Golf Course inside. And Koi mil Gaya shooting has been done. A refreshing day.

title: A beautiful piece of british architecture
review: Governer's house is beautiful piece of British architecture. It is very lavish house which almost looks like a palace.

title: Nice place must see
review: This place is one of the main attraction of  Nainital and one of the must see place.This one is the good architectural building of British government of India.

title: Time Pass
review: Visit if you are in Nanital. A one-time visit.

title: best place in nainital especially for elderly
review: this place is best in Nainital especially if you are going with elderly or those with difficulty in walking / climbing stairs.Guided tour starts @ 11 am therefore don't do before that & also stick to the timings or else wait for another hour. best is to go by taxi & then one can easily walk to the main building which is located nearly 200 m from the entry gate & the guide will show you different plants & trees on the way if you are interested. the building is located in the midst of huge sprawling lawns surrounded by many ornamental trees. the tourists are allowed only upto the foyer these days though earlier one could visit some of the rooms in absence of state guests or the Governor , but now nobody is allowed access beyond the foyer bcoz of damage done to the glass window panes by some tourists.

title: Fantastic architecture
review: Raj bhawan has an old world charm and it gives you a glimplse of the marvel of British architecture. The surroundings are picturesque..the pine trees one trident shaped tree golf course.

title: A truly Elegant Building
review: The Raj Bhavan and the old governors house at snow point must not be confused. The Raj Bhavan is a truly gorgeous building in classical British style with extensive gardens and other properties around it.

title: GOOD GOVERNANCE
review: Please make a visit to this place.  Entry ticket is Rs.50/-.  You can see the palatial building with lot of wooden fixtures.  Golf Ground surrounded with greenery is worth watching.  Guide will accompany you to show the various places inside this Raj Bhavan.  Please carry I.D. PROOF with you,

title: Governer House of Naintal Is a must see destination.
review: One of the Most Joyful and interesting spot is Governor House in Nainital; where you can visit by paying ticket charge of 50 rs each(in 2016). It looks like a copy of Burkinghum palace. Security allows only 4 people at a time; on every hour and they will provide you Guide also. you can see a police chauki where "koi mil gaya"; hritik's Jadoo movie was shooted. Also most beautiful part the Golf course inside and botanical verity in side the campus. Photography can be done in campus but not allowed inside Governor House. Inside House you will see ancient medals and Ancient Guns; swords. Whole house is made of Lime stone and burma wood.it will giveyou feel of Royal Castle.

title: Well maintained
review: Visiting this place was quite enjoyable.  there is an entry ticket but worth visiting this place.  Must must go spot.

title: HISTORY LINGERS
review: Though still in use by the Uttarakhand Governor, the place has a history and lots to say about its architectural specialties.

title: A british constuction heritage property now the governors residence
review: This is an old time built castle by British and houses a golf course and beautiful gardens in the pine forest .. it had more than 100 rooms .. there is a chargeable guided tour and one can visit only the entrance hall of this property ..

title: India's Buckinghum palace
review: A large area is present surrounding Governor house in Nainital. The house has a specific architectural characteristic which makes it a look alike of Buckinghum palace. The rooms, things and views inside the building is also very attractive.

title: Replica of Buckingam palace
review: The place is the house of Governor of Uttrakhand state in Nainital. It is very similar to the structure of Buckingam palace in london and made by britishers in 1897 and still has some of the artefacts from that time. It has 56 rooms and 14 Bedrooms which are not open to Public. Some of the trees outside the palace are more than 100 years old and very high and straight with massive trunks. Nice place with some history, worth a visit, it is 10 mins drive from Nainital lake at a height.

title: Governor's Bungalow Nainital (Indian version of Buckingham Palace)
review: Governor's Bungalow constructed during the British governance which is a scaled model of Buckingham Palace, UK. This is a must visit place in Nainital. A walk through the heritage site gives you a fascinating experience of the old British days. Even though the major portions of Raj bhavan is closed because its used by the Governor of Utharakhand. The state of architecture & Interior amazes everyone even though we have a restricted entrance.

title: Nice tourist place & must visit for an informed citizen of country
review: About the place:

title: British Heritage Construction
review: Constructed by Britishers the Governors House is a must visit place. Huge sprawling property with British workmanship . Very nicely maintained

title: More than half of it is shut for maintainance.
review: The place was huge and beautiful but was closed due to repair work. Would advise to find out before going here whether to go or not to go.

title: A wonderful Example of British Architecture
review: Take a stroll through the verdant green landscape to reach this beautiful building, with its surrounding gardens and woodlands.

title: nice and  must  place to visit
review: good place and location and lots of things to see about the history and artifacts and facts and figures of nainital

title: Majestic
review: British architecture, imposing building. Visitors allowed to the hall. View of grand wooden staircase.

title: Hugely overrated
review: You can't even get into the chambers of the house. Huge hype for the house. The exterior view is beautiful, but they do not allow you to enter into the rooms. No photography allowed inside the Governor's house. The golf course and the scenery is not something that you cannot see in other places.

title: The Raj era building.
review: This is an excellent illustration of the British Raj era architecture. The wooden structure is very unique.  Obviously, this is much more than a home for the colonial goveeners. Worth spending about an hour to cover this, access to this heritage site is restricted. Good place to go while visiting Nainital.

title: Huge
review: the governor house is having the high security but the place is so huge that a person need at least half day to look it

title: Excellent place built by Britishers in 1900
review: One who has interest in visiting British era buildings must visit this place in Nainital. It was built in 1900. There is a Golf course also. This 18 holes Golf Course was designed and developed by the Britishers in 1926. This Golf Course is a part of 220 acre Governor House Heritage Building, Nainital which was built by the Britishers in 1900.

title: Glory of Governor House!
review: We visited this place in morning time during our morning walks since it was very close to our hotel.The area is peaceful and there is one way of road from bus stand side for this place.

title: excellent architecture just fabulous.
review: there is a program which is conducted by a guide in the nainital raj bhwan at 4 pm. he shows everything detailed and what the raj bhwana is made up of. how it was made. the surroundings,the golf course,etc. everything in detail as the raj bhawan castle was made up of jaggery,dal,pulses,etc. please do visit it once. its just dreamalnd.

title: The Royal treat
review: The Governor's house is built in briton style. You shell your time and money (though paltry) to visit very limited view of Raj Bhawan.  A guide will take you to the small tour of few rooms.

title: Beggars belief
review: For a British person visiting this beggars belief.A vast mansion in the colonial style with very grand gardens.  It has a full security staff, etc, & is hardly ever used but costs huge amounts of public money to maintain.  In a country of such desperate poverty, homelessness etc this is an utter disgrace.  But it gives a vivid idea both of what things were like in the colonial era & what things are like with India's current lords & masters...

title: Fascinating Heritage Walk of Raj Bhavan
review: Well organised heritage walk of the garden, part of the building and the golf course by knowledgeable guides

title: Great place to view
review: Superb place to visit in nainital,never miss it,awesome,no words about its housekeeping,maintenance,ultimate place.

title: Beautiful heritage building
review: So glad that the government allows the public to visit this beautiful old property. Encourage everyone to go there and see the heritage architecture.

title: visit to Governers House
review: One of the best places to visit in nainital during summers and autum. The building itself is worth seeing. Long time back a fire took place and after that the building was reconstructed. The lush green gold course is one of the best golf courses in and around NAINITAL, The area is full of greenery and bamboo bushes. A place on the top is named JHANDIDAR. . A small swimming pool is also located in that area. The view from Jhandidar is breath taking. All the curves of the Haldwani, Nainital Road, The hanuman Garhi temple, the observatory and the beautiful land scape of the hills is visible from here. One more interesting thing here is a tunnel on the last golf ground. There is a saying that it was built by tipu sultan the great dacoit. Though it may not be so but when we were in school we used to enter this tunnel and complete the entire stretch. It was quite adventurous. A very nice place for the kids to have adventurous activities. A fantastic place to have a picnic and fun and frolicking. Overall a good place to visit for all those who love nature

title: Heritage Building
review: Gothik Style Building - some say its miniature of Bikingam Palace UK. more than 100 years old building, well maintained, ofcourse its under Uttarakhad State and residence of Hon'ble Governor of Uttarakhand State. one must visit and place is having great History of itself. - Superve Place and adjoining of this building a 18 holes high altitude Gold Course. some time you can see Wild Life and some endangerious sepcies. if you are in Naiital - must visit this place. You will have to pay entry fee to go inside.

title: Modelled on the Buckingham palace!!!
review: The Governor's House was built in victorian gothic style in the line of Buckingham Palace,now it serves as the the official accommodation of Governor (Uttarakhand).

title: Good place
review: Good place. Close to the mall road like every other place in Nainital. Not that high ont eh list though

title: A magnificent palace...
review: Now used by the Governor of Uttarakhand, this building is palatial spreading over a huge area. The building construction wise is truly magnificent with beautiful and intricate wooden furniture and stairs and railings. The wood used here are high quality Burma teak.

title: Victorian Villa
review: Majestically located in the valleys of Nainital..This gubernatorial residence could possibly be matched in magnificence with only that of Viceregal Lodge Shimla. A do not miss when visiting Nainital

title: Peace with pride and Royal
review: It's only 1km away from bus stand. Opening in 11 am. Entry fees is 50 rs. and you will get a full guide tour for 1 hour. This tour covered all spots including inside the governer house.

title: must visit place
review: Not many know that Governor's house is open for public viewing. Some parts of it are open for public and with a guided tour one gets to know a lot about the history of this place

title: royal living
review: this is on 230acres of land, with a golf course garden & a huge mansion, which is still being maintained by the state worth a visit

title: A heritage property!
review: A nice attraction though not very publicised. The entrance charge is just INR 50 includes a guided tour of approx. 40 min. The guides are knowledgable and entertain with interesting historic snippet incl. the fact that the entrance was shown in the movie "koi mil gaya" as the police station. The property is spread into some 200+ acres incl. a golf course. The main building is a heritage building built by britishers. Its architecturally reminds of 'Tower of London' and hence worth visiting. The tour inside the building is very small and the tourist authority should increase the number of rooms they open to public. Overall a must visit, but pls ensure you visit early as the attraction closes early at around 4:30pm

title: Impressive Estate
review: We went to the Governor's bunglow with very high expectations. The information provided on the net said that it opened at 8 am. When we went there at 9.30, to our dismay we were informed that it would open at 11 am. When we finally did go in, the walk to the Governor's bunglow with it's beautiful garden and landscaping was nice. But the biggest disappointment came when we were shown only the front reception hall and nothing beyond that. The guide was not very clear in his speech. We most definitely felt cheated. It was a big waste of time and effort.

title: Good
review: more than 100 years old building, well maintained,its under Uttarakhad State. one must visit and place is having great History of itself. The foundation stone of the Nainital Government House, modeled after Buckingham Palace.

title: beautiful bungalow but a disappointing tour
review: I had visited this place in 2003 and we were taken to quite a few rooms then. But now i was pretty disappointed that our tour consisted on only one room and that was the foyer....bas! that was it! The guide was boring and most of the time we had no idea what he was droning on about.

title: The  Governors Hopuse is easily approachable  by hired taxies  frp, the local taxi stand .
review: The Governors House is about 2 kms. from the city and it is one of the heritege building of Ninital Governor comes here in the summer season for  rest and recuperation.  KMVN made special arrangements to visit this place.

title: Good Old Govvies ( Governors House)
review: A must visit if you are ever in Nainital. . A grand old castle look like the main house is full of history from the  days of the Raj to Independent India .Sit in nook at the entrance and take in the history . Photographs of leaders greet you as does some armory( some belonging to a thug from terai (im not going to name him go and find out )Most portions are not open to the public so be careful. Take a walk around the castle and do try and get a look in the summer room . Seat of power during the summer during the Raj -an entire army of clerks and civil servants would make this place their summer home . In tradition - The Governor is  in residence in the summer .

title: Beautiful place-Must visit
review: The entry to this place happens in group at an interval of one hour.Tickets are available just outside the house and conter generally opens 10-15 mins before each entry. Though the place seems to be a normal architecture at the entry but soon as you go deeper into the natural beauty of the place, you witness a beautiful palace like governor house made in stone and it really is a very beautiful building.The surroundings are full of greenery and the weather was perfect for an outing. As you grow deeper into the walk ways between the trees,the place leaves a romantic effect on your senses and you just want to enjoy the walks more. Soon you reach the path near the gof course and they vie of the golf course between the trees in misty clouds and view of the mountains in the backdrop is just mesmerizing.

title: Lovely walk and visit inside
review: Parts of the Governor's house is opened for public viewing, a government appointed guide takes a group on the tour after tickets are purchased. The golf course and the forest around it are worth seeing.

title: historical icon
review: it a summer residence of governor when there was no air conditions were available in the markets so british viceroy constructed this house for his use...

title: Awesome place to live if you are the Governor
review: I came across while sight seeing in our rented car. The structure is surely eye catching and entices you to observe closely with its vast surroundings and the golf couse within (which came as a surprise to me). I figured out that the Raj Bhawan/ Governor's House served as the summer capital of United Provinces and this building was built by British as a residence for the Governor of the then North West Province. Impressive to know that the estate is spread over 205 acre of area with a Golf Course in 45 acre of land with marvellous gardens to admire. A sight for the sore eyes definielty.

title: Worth the visit
review: You get to see the grandeur of the colonial days. This palace, converted to a governor's house is impeccably well maintained and deserves your visit.

title: Can't say must but a good visit...
review: This place and Shimla's governor house served the same purpose for the Britishers i.e. accommodation during summers. If one has visited Shimla's, this is nothing as Shimla was more grand and more architectural beautiful. The only difference being this governor house still serve the purpose of accommodation of UP governor, President and Prime minister of India.

title: Time waste
review: They will take you to the hall and show you everything from there inly. You just imagine and come back. after seeing a golf ground. Area is so big so you can enjoy a well established jungle view from there. nothing else.

title: Colonial Splendour
review: Nice place to visit when you are in Nainital . It is located in a wonderful location  and has the colonial touch in architecture.

title: Old world charm amidst the clouds!
review: Surrounded by Deodar trees and hidden behind an eerie mist, the Governor House or Raj Bhawan in Nainital is built over 200 acres of land... The winding narrow lanes up to the hill top where it is situated is an experience in itself. There's a serious space crunch if you are travelling by one of those SUVs though! A cheerful guide greeted us at the gate and thus began our walk towards Colonial history. The building was built on the lines of the Buckingham Palace we were told. It is an imposing sight amidst the clouds. The mist lifts only for a few seconds to allow us a clear view, and before we could click a few pictures it was back to add that same eerie mysterious look (nothing scary about it though!) A guided tour of the Raj Bhawan led us to the huge mouldy ball room, antique show pieces and beautiful wooden work. It's sad visitors are not allowed up the steps for a view of the ball room from above. It was a wonderful experience but a little better up keep of the structure and its interiors might go a long way in restoring its past grandeur.

title: Off beat but worth a visit
review: The Governor's House is not on the normal 'point' list of most or all cabbies.  However it is definitely worth a visit.

title: i believe the only rajbhawan in india open to tourists.
review: the guided tour at rajbhawan statrts at 10;30 am with hourly intervals-the tour starts at the well maintained gardens, golf course, ponds, reservoirs, andA TRISHUL SHAPED DEODAR TREEE, only a very small portion on the ground floor of the raj bhawan is open to public.the COLOUR photo of MR NAMO is seems to be 'ODD MAN OUT"

title: A royal experience
review: You can go there with special permission from the local authorities.  A big mansion with architecture and decor of the British times.  Having a big Golf course besides it swirling around the trees and mountains.

title: I gave my lawn a manicure
review: carefully manicured lawns, gazebos and plentiful flora & fauna define this lovely histric retreat. Go for the breathe of fresh air, enjoy the treat for the eyes, and hear the stories as well.

title: Nainital - Jun 15
review: This is a must visit in Nainital. However, it can be closed if Governor or any government dignitary is visiting that time. The visit is organized in batches with guide at every hour (11 AM, 12 PM, 1 PM and so on). In the governor house, entry is allowed inside the building but till the staircase. The guide will show you the details. The outside is also pretty picturesque. It will take roughly 1 hour to visit if timed well with batches.

title: Simply wow
review: A replica of Buckingham palace. Awesome building which boasts of colonial luxury. Great locality and completely worth 1 hr that need to be spent for the visit

title: Historical site
review: a nice look back at British Architecture and the place they adored... beautiful ambiance but visit if you have time not very required

title: serene Jim corbett
review: Yeah its a look a like but there are more picturisque things in nainital. Jim corbett nearby is a better place to go and see after nainital. Its serene out there in the resorts.

title: must see
review: It is the most beautiful place in Nainital. The house has 365 rooms and the house is amazing. The Golf Course here is also too good. Everyone who visits Nainital must see this place

title: Amazing architecture
review: Governor's house. Initially we thought it might be a very simple premise. But when we entered the property and got guided by the person accompanying us from the ticket counter, we were amused. The campus is serene. green with tall standing trees. There is a huge golf course inside the premise (approx 50 acres). Once we walk to the main area (raj bhawan), stands the building which is constructed by the same architect who designed the Buckingham palace. A simply awesome spell bounding architecture. Photography is not allowed inside the house. The house inside has a very big lobby, a well maintained visiting hall, glass room and recreation rooms for leisure, meeting hall, rooms for chief guest and residence for governor. A must visit place for architecture freaks. Located approx 3 Kms from mall road. Entry fee Rs. 50 for adults.  Closed on Sundays.

title: It's history in view
review: A must visit in Nainital. It's a nicely maintained building at the best of the location. It's surely a piece of history and gives you a feel of the British hill station

title: Fell the Royality
review: During the britishers time it  was called "Court House .This place is located on the other side of the lake, it is really nice and it is open to public on the days when Governor is not there. The area is 220 acres and was built in the line of Buckingham Palace London.

title: Royalty in Paradise!!
review: Accompanied by a guide had stroll in the Governor house and 18-hole golf course built in 1897. The walk In 220 acres it is built in line of Buckingham Palace London, having double storied 113 rooms. Has lush green gardens and surrounded by Deodar and Oak trees some believed 500 yrs old.

title: Taste of days of the Raj
review: Gorgeous ornate building, the guide was good, well worth the visit. The first floor is out of bounds, as VIP's are often in residence. Photographs of events held in the building a century ago would bring the tour much more to life.

title: history well preserved
review: very good pre independence building. well preserved structure.  plz ask for English speaking guide. don't miss the golf course inside. don't forget to take your camera

title: stunning location
review: beautiful governors house, and a stunning golf course, the walk was the loveliest partof the trip, and the view fomr the golf course to the terai was amazing.definatley will be back .

title: awesome
review: what a place, a gold course attached to it, its just amazing, being a golfer its a beautiful course to play, one of the best scenic course i have played, just enjoy every time i go there.

title: Big Mansion...
review: Sprawling acres of beautifully landscaped property with a huge mansion... place with a golf course too...

title: Ex Governor House
review: This was probably the summer capital in the Raj Era that has been converted into a Tourist Guest House. The look and feel was indeed great.

title: Poor
review: They have stopped public visit  . It was so bad. We drove all the way . The best bit was to see the famous -Sherwood College and the All Saints School .

title: Heritage place
review: If you like history this is one place you must visit in Nainital, It is a majestic building with sprawling lawns which transports you into another era! I love history and historical places so this place was special as this place is a witness to so many events in our history!

title: Watch from outside...
review: Governor's House also known Raj Bhavan and formerly, Government House was built in 1899 and designed in the Victorian Gothic domestic style (also called "domestic Gothic") by the architect F.W. Stevens. Originally built as the summer residence of the governor of the North West Province, it later became the summer residence for the Lieutenant Governor of the United Provinces. Currently, Raj Bhavan is the official guest house for the governor of Uttarakhand and for visiting state guests. The complex consists of a two-storied mansion with 113 rooms, a large garden, a swimming pool, and golf links. Obtaining prior permission is a "must" for visiting.

title: Governor's House,Nainital
review: Magnificeint structure on a well spread campus.

title: Good Old Era Heritage Building
review: Good for history lovers and if you love old heritage buildings. Good architecture with good surroundings. It is a majestic building with sprawling lawns. Nice explanation by KMVN guide.

title: Cant go inside
review: The Governor's House is no longer open for public. We were disappointed after a drive till the gates.No idea how it looks fom inside

title: What a building
review: Since on 1st day , Governor was here so could not visit.

title: Governor house
review: Is this that good to see, went to Nainital but never thought of seeing this house. let me know if its worth watching

title: The Villa
review: it is situated on a hill and it is an amazing place for Governor stay. Most of the time the permission is not there to visit inside. The place is royal. Must visit if you get permission to go inside

title: Nice place built during british raj
review: This place is located on the other side of the lake, it is really nice and it is open to public on the days when it is not occupied by the Governor or any of his guest. A guide does accompany the group for both information and security purpose. There is a nice golf course and if you have time can play there after paying a reasonable fee.

title: Beautiful
review: The building is so beautiful with sprawling lawns and a golf course u seem to be in a fairy land indeed im jealous of people who get to stay there

title: A step into the past
review: The grounds are fabulous and the house is just something else.  The Governor had just left (a lady Governor at that) and they were packing the house up - but the furniture, the paintings, photographs and memorabilia were all fascinating.  some parts were like an English medieval manor house.

title: A must see place
review: The governor's house was among the best experiences we had during the entire Nainital trip.

title: Beautiful Arichitecture
review: Governor house or Raj Bhawan as it is called is two-storied building with 113 rooms, swimming pool, garden and Golf Course. It is highly influenced by western architecture and design. Beautiful lakes amidst green laden mountains and lavish landscapes has been a source of inspiration to design this countryside mension.

title: Just about average
review: Visited this place as part of the tour around nainital. Nothing great to offer, although if you like

title: Its closed these days for general public veiwing
review: guys if your tourist guide tells you that this sight seeing is included in their package then do not believe him as due to some reasons this place is closed for public viewing , our tour guide will take ou to the entrance only.... i do not know when they are opening for public veiwing again.

title: GREEN GREEN GREEEEEN
review: Wow!!! This place is amazing. A golf course in the middle of nowhere, surrounded by Forest. What amazing views!!! I have been to this place twice and recommend that go here early in the morning. The dew makes it look even more beautiful and you really get to know about the power of nature. Great place for nature lovers and who don't, will definitely start loving nature!!!
